text: Hi Jaidev, My apologies as I signed up to this as a technical person within the VFX industry.

So yes your research is correct. VFX = Visual Effects. It really started out back in the days of (mostly) film and consisted of either physical or optical effects to help enhance the story and create special effects.
This is all pre computer of course....
Physical effects might be making miniature models for a dinosaur movie, gory makeup and rubber prosthetics for  horror movie
and optical might be somebody in a studio 'driving' a car and the background is projected onto a screen behind them
or the credits for a film were all optical. the titles would be projected into a box and a prism used to show the film and then the titles would appear on top!
Then when computers were more affordable we used them to create effects that people had previously never been able to create (or even imagine)
And in actual fact whilst SciFi films use lots of FX EVERY film these days has some kind of fx in it

think about a roman ampitheatre. These days if you wanted to shoot that youd have a problem. First where in the world exists a complete ampitheratre? Then does it look like you want it to in your film? then if you want to fill the terraces with people think how many 'extras' you would need to dress up and PAY!!
so in CG (computer generated) the 3D team create a virtual ampitheatre. the shoot crew make a tiny 'slice' of the set and use maybe 20x extras
then the CG team make the rest of the theatre and copy the 20x people several hundred times (virtually) and suddenyl you have a roman ampitheatre!!

So I work with all of the technology that the artists use to create their work. From the power/mains, through to the softwares needed, to the pipeline (the method and how you connect all the softwares together) and then fixing it when it goes wrong!! :slightly_smiling_face:
